google_play_reviews.content: Great app, works perfectly! My only issue is it doesn't support timestamps past 99:59.99... i hope this problem will be fixed!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! The limit is 99:59.99 as most songs are around 3 minutes long. I understand there could be a case where you have a several songs clubbed together resulting in a longer file. While I could technically increase the limit, there's no guarantee that music players will support it. Nevertheless, the app is open source and I welcome PRs on this.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Desync issues like the one you're facing could happen if you use a low quality variable bitrate MP3 file or something similar to it. google_play_reviews.content: I really love this app. There are a few improvements I would like to see added to improve it. - Dark mode (preferably OLED black) - An option to have the LRC file be named the same as the audio file by default - An option to save the LRC file to the same location as the selected audio track by default - Changing the positioning and/or sice of the "Add timestamp" and "Play lyric" buttons to avoid misclicks - Having the app remember the selected audio for each LRC Other than that, great app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Thanks for the fabulous review! This includes editing the selected line as well as inserting more lyrics above/below the currently selected one.

google_play_reviews.content: does not embed lyrics to the mp3, it just link an additional lrc file

google_play_reviews.content: Great app for editing lyrics files, one feature i think that is missing the the ability ty synchronize a lyrics file to a song by shifting all the time stamps ahead of behind by a certain time. I downloaded some lyric files form the internet and they are out of sync, so i have to do it all over again. Edit: Thanks, so much. This feature is already there, i just couldn't find it the first time.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! You seem to be looking for the batch edit feature. Hold on lyric items (or use select all button at the toolbar at the top) which needs a timestamp offset and select the batch edit feature in the toolbar at the top. Then choose the offset to increase/decrease the timestamps of the selected lyric items with and press ok. And you're done!

google_play_reviews.content: wonderful application :D If I could rate it 10 stars as the highest, then I wouldn't hesitate to do so.

Well it's an useful app for editing .lrc files, but when you use it for too long the timestamps are delayed by a very big ammount (like 1.5s) so I wish the developer(s) can fix that in the newer updates.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! The desync/delay issue is most likely caused by compressed music files like a low quality variable bitrate MP3 file. The system will have a hard time seeking to precise locations when you use these music files. Use a high quality constant bitrate MP3 file or another music container suited for precise seeking if you need better accuracy

google_play_reviews.content: I love the app, I got used to using it but there's a problem, when I set an exactly time the app moves it forward a few seconds or milliseconds, I'd like you all to fix it, please the app is good! Don't mess it up!!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! The issue you mention is caused by low quality variable bitrate music files which do not have accurate seek information in them. google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! I assume you're taking about LG's stock music player. LG's stock music player unfortunately does not support lyrics via LRC files. It only supports lyrics embedded into the music file.

google_play_reviews.content: The greatest LRC creator and editor. Easy to use with simple features but please add more features like a timer and more exciting features. Thanks developer for creating such an app for android.

google_play_reviews.content: This is not really my final review yet. I just want to know how it works. I already tried the app and create my own lyrics. So when I'm done I opened my samsung music app and check the song but the lyrics didn't show up. What should I do with it? EDIT: After reading some reviews, i finally know what to do and it works. I look forward on using this app. üëèüëç
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! When you're done syncing the lyrics, click on the "Set as song file name" button in the save dialog and save the LRC file in the same folder as the song. Samsung's music player will show lyrics when the LRC file is saved with the same name as the music file in the same location. Example: song.mp3 and song.lrc in the same folder

It's a great and very useful app. But sometimes there can be a lack of accuracy after setting the time stamp. You can notice it when you play the songs on the device music player. Would be of great help if you could correct this issue. BTW, I m using Samsung music on galaxy s9
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Timestamps can be inaccurate when you use a music container that isn't designed for accurate seeking like a variable bitrate MP3 file. Try using a high quality constant bitrate MP3 files or another music container better suited for precise seeking so that the system can seek to precise locations, eliminating timestamp desync issues

The simplest and best. I will also use it as a timestamp - bookmark creator and player for mp3 recordings. The only problem for this use is that it will not be possible to create bookmarks for recordings with longer duration than 99 minutes, 59 seconds and 99 milliseconds, which is at most 1 hour and 40 minutes. Thank you :)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for the compliments! And yes, timestamps have a 99:59.999 limit as this was intended for songs and songs are usually not that long.

i think, it's not compatible with my phone? the timing is going off whenever i saved it.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! The timing might be off if you used a low quality variable bitrate mp3 file. The system will have a hard time decoding and seeking the playing to exact positions. You could either make sure that the mp3 file is of a constant bitrate or use another music container that is designed for precise seeking to fix the timing desync issues.
